intro: Dalechampia scandens var. pallida, commonly known as the pale leaf hemp vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a trailing vine, often found in moist, wooded areas. Its leaves are palmately lobed and can vary in color from green to reddish-brown depending on the season. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique foliage and floral display.
